channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping Chesterfield Grove (along the wall of Joe the Juice shop) 5th Complaint, 8th January
item.description:
5th complaint submitted: Increase of flytipped items that has still not been cleared. Extra black bags of rubbish which now has a severe stench and now 2 chairs dumped. It is a health and safety danger in encouraging vermin for residents including children, the elderly and the wider community. This is simply not acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement broken slabs, 8th January
item.description:
Damaged pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The dog waste bin on the green area by Southdown House is overflowing, 8th January
item.description:
Health hazard and eyesore - the dog poo bin on the green area - near the playground and Southdown House - hasn’t been emptied in weeks. Waste is overflowing and being dumped on top. Sort it out Southwark Council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pytchley Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooded Blocked Drains, 8th January
item.description:
This drain is constantly blocked and when it rains it floods heavily. Immersing the parked car wheels and tyres unwater for hours (which can have huge safety implications and damage the wheels). This drain has been reported many times but has never been resolved. The fraunnis litaged directly outside house 104 Thorpedale Road N4.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Thorpedale Road, Finsbury Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned van, 8th January
item.description:
This van has been parked on this road since 30th December 2025… there are load of goods in the back of it that don’t look legitimate/stolen. The local foxes are now in the van (as it’s open in the back for good to be transported) digging in the boxes and packages sitting in it, probably looking for things for their home. There are what looks like brand new duvets and pillows and other boxes. This road has recently been made permit holders only but no one has moved this van or come to check on it….

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Sturdy Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Needs to be removed. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kenilworth Road, Penge, Greater London

item.title: Misuse and danger to passengers, 8th January
item.description:
A personal electric car was being charged nearby with the electric cable running from an upper window of a house onto the bus shelter down to the car. It was raining heavily with passengers waiting to board the W3 bus underneath and passengers disembarking off the bus.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ferme Park Road, Crouch End, Greater London

item.title: Drain entirely blocked internally, 8th January
item.description:
Hi, There are 2 drains ob the corner and the one furthee up the road as indicated on the map is entirely blocked up internally causing the drain direct on the corner to become overwhelmed. I clear that drain regularly. The occupant on the corner bungalow is disabled and there us a concern that the water has been crossing the pavement and will freeze to ice causing a danger to pedestrians and cars also. Regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Corbylands Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 8th January
item.description:
Large pot hole with 3 others right near to it. Dangerous for motorbikes and car tyres. The hole way round the roundabout is full of deep potholes , abd where it was oootky patched further round on the way back to cray road also cracking and other potholes!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Road, Greater London

item.title: Surface water flooding - Blocked plublic drain, 8th January
item.description:
There is so much Surface water flooding due to Blocked plublic drain. This drain constantly gets blocked and its about to block the pavement with water. Needs urgent clearing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellenden Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 40 on Grafton Way, 8th January
item.description:
The neighbours at number 30-40 have been suffering from a persistent, annoying, disruptive, disturbing, continuous noise that is affecting our lives. Please could Camden borough take responsibility for keeping the neighbours awake at night? This is a residential and more over, and oncology hospital area, where people are sick, and also get sick from convulsing noises like this one. Please Could you help us?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grafton Way, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain outside 30 Durham Road, 8th January
item.description:
Water flowing straight over drain resulting in flooding further down Durham Road. Drain grate is clear, indicating blockage below grate as water flows over grate rather than into it. Drain in front of street bench, near house 30 Durham Road, Bromley. This is the 4th report at this location, as reports keep being closed without the issue actually being fixed, going back more than 2 years. One such report just resulted in the drain being tarmacced over instead of repaired and the fault closed. This drain being blocked means lower down Durham Road can't cope with the volume of water when it rains because this drain intercepts water coming down the hill from Durham Avenue & Westmoreland Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
